yolo package¶

Submodules¶

yolo.darknet module¶

wrapper from AlexeyAB darknet repo https://github.com/AlexeyAB/darknet

Python 3 wrapper for identifying objects in images Running the script requires opencv-python to be installed (pip install opencv-python) Directly viewing or returning bounding-boxed images requires scikit-image to be installed (pip install scikit-image) Use pip3 instead of pip on some systems to be sure to install modules for python3

yolo.darknet.bbox2points(bbox)¶

From bounding box yolo format to corner points cv2 rectangle

yolo.darknet.class_colors(names)¶

Create a dict with one random BGR color for each class name

yolo.darknet.decode_detection(detections)¶
yolo.darknet.detect_image(network, class_names, image, thresh=0.5, hier_thresh=0.5, nms=0.45)¶

Returns a list with highest confidence class and their bbox

yolo.darknet.draw_boxes(detections, image, colors)¶
yolo.darknet.load_network(config_file, data_file, weights, batch_size=1)¶

load model description and weights from config files

Parameters

  • config_file – path to .cfg model file

  • data_file – path to .data model file

  • weights – path to weights

Returns

network: trained model, class_names and class_colors

yolo.darknet.remove_negatives(detections, class_names, num)¶

Remove all classes with 0% confidence within the detection

yolo.darknet.remove_negatives_faster(detections, class_names, num)¶

Faster version of remove_negatives (very useful when using yolo9000)

yolo.darknet_images.load_images(images_path)¶

If image path is given, return it directly For txt file, read it and return each line as image path In other case, it’s a folder, return a list with names of each jpg, jpeg and png file

Files saved with image_name.txt and relative coordinates

yolo.predict module¶

Use yolo python wrapper to make prediction

yolo.predict.detection(weights: str, input_image: str, datafile: str, cfg: str) → tuple¶

Use yolo to detect classes in the image. Work only on 1 image with its path. Important you need to have created libdarknet.so at the compilation. return the detection with bounding boxes, the image (with boxes on it) and class color.

Parameters

  • weights – path of the best weights file (after training)

  • input_image – path of an image

  • datafile – path of yolo datafile (example obj.data) use for the training

  • cfg – path of yolo config file (example yolov4-custom.cfg) use for training

yolo.predict.detection_several_image(weights: str, input_file: str, datafile: str, cfg: str) → dict¶

Use yolo to detect classes in the image. Work on a set of image with a txt file which contains all the path of images. Important you need to have created libdarknet.so at the compilation. return a dict with the detection for each image and save the image with bounding boxes in data.

Parameters

  • weights – path of the best weights file (after training)

  • input_file – path of a txt file with several image path

  • datafile – path of yolo datafile (example obj.data) use for the training

  • cfg – path of yolo config file (example yolov4-custom.cfg) use for training

yolo.predict.extract_text(detection: list, image: numpy.ndarray) → str¶

Extract text from an image for a given bounding box of yolo return string of the text

Parameters

  • detection – yolo detection

  • image – image

yolo.predict.image_detection_dont_show(image_path: str, network, class_names: dict, thresh: float) → tuple¶

image detection from darknet wrapper, with support of dont_show in classe name like in bash yolo (dont_show classe are ignored).

Parameters

  • image_path – path of the image

  • network – model trained

  • class_names – name of the different classe

  • thresh –

yolo.predict.merge_bbox(detections: list, classe: str) → list¶

Merge boxe with the same classe label return yolo list detection

Parameters

  • detections – yolo detection list

  • classe – name of the classe to merge

yolo.predict.point2bbox(xmin: int, ymin: int, xmax: int, ymax: int) → tuple¶

convert an opencv point to bounding boxe of yolo return bounding box of yolo

Parameters

  • xmin – x of the top right corner point

  • ymin – y of the top right corner point

  • xmax – x of the bottom left corner point

  • ymax – y of the bottom left corner point

yolo.predict.recipe_process(weights: str, input: str, datafile: str, cfg: str) → tuple¶

process a ticket with yolo return image with boxes merged and the text of each classes in dict

Parameters

  • weights – path of the best weights file (after training)

  • input – path of an image

  • datafile – path of yolo datafile (example obj.data) use for the training

  • cfg – path of yolo config file (example yolov4-custom.cfg) use for training

yolo.predict_opencv module¶

prediction without darknet with only opencv more information: https://opencv-tutorial.readthedocs.io/en/latest/yolo/yolo.html

yolo.predict_opencv.detection_darknet_format(img: numpy.ndarray, outputs: numpy.ndarray, conf: float, classes: list) → list¶

convert opencv detection in yolo darknet detection format

Parameters

  • img – image

  • outputs – outputs of opencv nn

  • conf – threshold

  • classes – list of all classes

Returns

list with yolo detection format ( tupple (classe, probability, bbox))

yolo.predict_opencv.get_classes(classes_name_path: str) → tuple¶

get classes from darknet classe name file

Parameters

classes_name_path – path of the classe name file

Returns

list with classe name and colors code

yolo.predict_opencv.get_network(cfg_path: str, weights_path: str) → tuple¶

build darknet network with darknet config file and weights

Parameters

  • cfg_path – path of the config darknet file

  • weights_path – path of the weights

Returns

net and output layer

yolo.predict_opencv.load_image(path: str) → tuple¶

load image and process it to be used in open cv network

Parameters

path – path of the image

Returns

img and blob for opencv

yolo.predict_opencv.process_image(image_path: str, cfg_path: str, weights_path: str, classes_name_path: str) → tuple¶

process a ticket with yolo using open cv (no darknet)

Parameters

  • image_path – path of the image

  • cfg_path – path of the config darknet file

  • weights_path – weights_path: path of the weights

  • classes_name_path – path of the classe name file

Returns

image with boxes and the text of each classes in dict
